function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Poor ventilation and cooling in high-density urban area may increase the risk of airborne disease transmission.","Impact":"Increased risk of contagious disease spread among building occupants.","Mitigation":"Improved ventilation and filtration systems, regular maintenance, and adherence to public health guidelines.","Technologies":"Advanced HVAC systems, air purifiers, and real-time air quality monitoring.","People":"Building occupants, maintenance staff, and visitors.","Owner":"Building management, maintenance team, public health authorities."},{"Description":"Inadequate flexibility and storage options may limit the adaptation of building systems to future disease prevention measures.","Impact":"Reduced ability to implement flexible working arrangements and responsive disease control measures.","Mitigation":"Installation of energy storage systems, adoption of smart grid technologies, and flexible workspace design.","Technologies":"Energy storage solutions, smart grid infrastructure, and modular workspace configurations.","People":"Building occupants, facility managers, and public health authorities.","Owner":"Building management, energy services providers, workspace designers."},{"Description":"Limitations on the implementation of renewable energy sources may hinder sustainable and resilient building operations during disease outbreaks.","Impact":"Reduced capacity for independent electricity generation and resilience to power disruptions.","Mitigation":"Exploration of alternative renewable energy sources, evaluation of off-site renewable energy options, and integration of energy-efficient technologies.","Technologies":"Photovoltaic systems, wind turbines, and off-site renewable energy procurement.","People":"Building occupants, energy managers, and sustainability professionals.","Owner":"Building management, energy suppliers, sustainability consultants."}]}
